slides.title: Customer Surveys

content.headline: Get Real Feedback from Real Customers

slides.narration: Want to know what customers really think? Surveys get you direct feedback—but only if they're designed right. Most surveys get ignored. Let's build ones that get responses.

slides.title: What You'll Learn

topics: Survey types and when to use them

slides.narration: We'll cover survey types and when to use each, designing questions that get honest answers, timing and delivery for maximum response, and most importantly—acting on results.

slides.title: Step 1: Choose Survey Type
slides.narration: Choose your survey type. NPS or Net Promoter Score is one question about likelihood to recommend—use after purchases. CSAT measures specific experience satisfaction—use immediately after interactions. Feedback surveys are longer, five to ten questions—use quarterly or after major purchases.

slides.title: Step 2: Design Questions
slides.narration: Question design principles. Keep it under three minutes total. Ask only one thing per question. Use scales for easy answering—one to five or one to ten. Include one open-ended question for rich feedback. Start with easy questions, put optional ones at the end.

slides.title: Step 3: Timing

content.note: Don't survey too often—once per quarter max per customer

slides.narration: Timing is critical. NPS surveys: twenty-four to forty-eight hours after purchase while memory is fresh. CSAT: within one hour of the interaction—strike while it's immediate. Feedback surveys: one to two weeks after to give perspective. Don't over-survey—once per quarter maximum per customer.

slides.title: Step 4: Delivery

tips: Tell them how long it takes

slides.narration: Delivery channels. Email is most common. SMS has higher open rates for short surveys. In-app or on-site works for digital interactions. QR codes at your location work for in-person. Always personalize the ask, tell them how long it takes, and explain why their feedback matters.

slides.title: Pro Tips

tips: Respond to every negative survey personally
Share positive feedback with your team
Track trends over time, not just individual scores
Close the loop—tell customers what you changed

slides.narration: Pro tips for surveys. Respond personally to every negative survey—this can save the relationship. Share positive feedback with your team—it's great for morale. Track trends over time, not just individual scores. Close the loop—tell customers what you changed based on their feedback.

slides.title: Create Survey
slides.narration: Ready to get feedback? Create your survey now—start with our NPS template for quick setup. Or browse templates to find the right fit. Your customers have opinions—let's hear them.
